definition: to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
classifier for sheets of papers etc: pile, pad/Taiwan pr. [ta4]

sentences.english: Does your child stall when it comes time to do homework?
sentences.chinese: 做作業的時候你的孩子有拖沓的毛病嗎？

sentences.english: Instead, think back to the few times when you didn’t procrastinate. What was different?
sentences.chinese: 反過來，回想一下你沒有拖沓的那幾次，有什麼不同？

sentences.english: It drags, unlike Bazzana’s Glenn Gould book.
sentences.chinese: 這本書拖沓，不像巴札納的那本古爾德。

sentences.english: Fear and procrastination are major enemies to success.
sentences.chinese: 恐懼和拖沓是成功的兩大要敵。

sentences.english: Prayerfully consider the price you may be paying for procrastination?
sentences.chinese: 深深地思考一下你可能會爲拖沓付出的代價吧？

sentences.english: If you are a procrastinator, stop procrastinating and start taking action right now.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是個磨蹭的人，停止拖沓並且現在就採取行動。

sentences.english: This is another major cause of schedule slippage.
sentences.chinese: 這是進度拖沓的另一個重要原因。

sentences.english: Procrastination is the enemy of accounting data input.
sentences.chinese: 財務數據輸入最忌諱的就是拖沓。

sentences.english: Whatever it is, procrastination can be overcome.
sentences.chinese: 但無論如何，拖沓是可以克服的。

sentences.english: Malefic thoughts spread laziness, procrastination, etc.
sentences.chinese: 不好的想法散播懶惰，拖沓等等。

sentences.english: But setting it up was a long and protracted process.
sentences.chinese: 但設立軍事熱線是一個漫長而拖沓的進程。

sentences.english: I purposely made it easy, so you wouldn’t procrastinate.
sentences.chinese: 我有意把它簡單化，這樣你就不會拖沓了。

sentences.english: If you slouch in your chair the interviewer will think you could be sloppy in your work as well.
sentences.chinese: 你斜倚在椅子裏，面試官會在工作上你也會拖沓鬆散。

sentences.english: Mix shilly-shally laggard working way should fight stoutly.
sentences.chinese: 猶豫不決和拖沓的工作作風是應該果斷反對的。

sentences.english: For them even small stretches of time seem to drag.
sentences.chinese: 對於他們伸個懶腰都會被看做是拖沓。

definition: to drag along/to haul/(fig.) to procrastinate/shilly-shallying/sluggish/(computing) drag and drop/(loanword) tola, unit of weight, approx. 11.664 grams
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
lit. tiger's head, snake's tail (idiom); fig. a strong start but weak finish
(of speech or actions) direct and efficient/without fooling around
